Articles.Content:
O.W.L II

STOCK CRAFT

**EDIT** (Here is an update for the O.W.L lander. Just a few little tweaks here and there. Flies better, lands better, looks better.

New pics below

the craft file has been updated on Spaceport. here's the new link.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/o-w-l-lander/

Let me know how you get on with it.

MJ

Edited August 20, 2013 by Majorjim
Very cool! I will definitely be using it to locate a good area for a base! Thanks for sharing man

I'm a fan. I especially like the detailing where the legs are attached. I'm also a big proponent of two stage landers, probably because of the Eagle lander from the Apollo missions.

You should post it in this thread too: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/37745-Showcase-Post-your-Moon-Planet-Landers-Thread-Lander-building-guide

Edited June 28, 2013 by GusTurbo

I would love the download! Most people seem a lot more creative when it comes to lander than me. I just get the job done. I guess you can just send me the link or post it on this thread, and in that case I'll just subscribe. I am very impressed.

I'm a fan. I especially like the detailing where the legs are attached. I'm also a big proponent of two stage landers, probably because of the Eagle lander from the Apollo missions.

Yes I should probably say that the O.W.L Lander is inspired by Mulbin's MunBug. You will notice a few similarities.

Thanks Mulbin!

Its finished now so as soon as I work out how to upload it, I will.

Its ready now for your landing pleasure.

How does one upload a ship?

pics!

I really do love the aesthetics. Great design.

To upload a ship, go to your Kerbal Space Program folder. From there, saves>[Your Save File Name]>Ships>O.W.L Lander.craft and upload that file wherever you want, Mediafire, Dropbox, etc.
that looks a very really cool lander....

Thanks for the kind words my little Kerbals.

Heres a pic of my safe return after another successful muna landing. Some say they are becoming routine..

I'm having trouble with my PC so will upload the .Craft file tomorrow.

Happy Friday all.

J
I love that your lander's ascent/return stage also has landing legs. There's an Xzibit joke to be made here.
This lander deserves more love. I personally think this game is undergoing a lander renaissance.
I agree with your lander renaissance theory. In fact, I just made my first lander that doesn't look extremely boring.

This lander deserves more love. I personally think this game is undergoing a lander renaissance.

I'm with you Gus. Ive got the lander bug now big time. I will do more on the OWL asap, just very busy getting the Lotus ready.

I cant wait to see what you guys come up with.

Hey Man, I'm really interested in your O.W.l lander, last edited on the 28th june 2013. but unfortunately the page this lander was posted on (this page) doesn't have a download link? i was hoping you could link me to the download? thanks.
download link?
Nice lander, can you provide a download link?
Fantastic looking lander! Would love a craft file

Now released on spaceport. Link in first post.

MJ

Your craft looks very cool, and very well made. The aesthetics of the ship are so good and compact, that I thought it was unmanned for a second. This will make a pretty useful lander for me. I'm going to download it and try it out. Thanks man!
Thanks all.

the craft file has been updated on Spaceport. here's the new link.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/o-w-l-lander/

Let me know how you get on with it.

MJ

That URL just gives a 404 -- searching on the Spaceport reveals nothing either.

That URL just gives a 404 -- searching on the Spaceport reveals nothing either.

Hi Caelib,

I thought I had updated this page. Its off Spaceport as I discovered some problems with the craft that I missed. Ive been meaning to update this but

to be honest I forgot.

Did you want just the lander or a launch vehicle too?

MJ
I'm just curious of the construction of the lander itself -- if you just have a part list/build order, that would be fine too.

I'm just curious of the construction of the lander itself -- if you just have a part list/build order, that would be fine too.

Ok mate, no problem. Its quite a simple lander, but very effective when teamed with a decent launch vehicle. I will upload the lander and post a link here as soon as I can.

MJ
Can you fix the pics?
